pageTitle: Detailed description of the Arnold Rönnebeck and Louise Emerson Rönnebeck papers, 1884-2002 | Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {5386=Arnold Rönnebeck was born in Nassau, Germany, in 1885 and became a noted sculptor and lithographer. He attended the Royal Art School in Berlin and Munich and moved to Paris in 1908 where he studied under Aristede Maillol and Emile Bourdelle. In 1922 he emigrated to the United States where he became part of the Stieglitz circle. In 1925 he visited Taos, New Mexico, and met his future wife, Louise Emerson, born Mary Louise Harrington Emerson in 1901. After their marriage, the Rönnebecks lived in Denver where Arnold Rönnebeck worked as director of Denver Art Museum and made a living mostly from his portrait busts. He died in 1947. Louise Emerson Rönnebeck died in 1980., 577=Arnold Rönnebeck and Louise Emerson Rönnebeck papers, 1884-2002. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution., 5740=Sculptor Arnold Rönnebeck (1885-1947) was part of the "Stieglitz circle" and settled in Denver where he served as director of the Denver Art Museum from 1926-1931. Rönnebeck married Louise Emerson (1901-1980) in 1926. Emerson was a painter and muralist who worked on New Deal mural commissions in Wyoming and Colorado., 1353=The collection was processed by Trina Yeckley in 2003, and a finding aid prepared by Stephanie Ashley in 2006., 1756=The papers were donated in 2001 by Ursula Moore Works and Arnold Rönnebeck, the artists' daughter and son., 4443=The papers of sculptor Arnold Rönnebeck and painter Louise Emerson Rönnebeck measure 3.6 linear feet and date from 1884-2002. The collection contains family and professional correspondence, sketches and drawings, writings, a scrapbook, printed material and numerous photographs of the Taos, New Mexico area and photographs of Charles Demuth, Marsden Hartley, Alfred Stieglitz, Mabel Dodge, and Tony Luhan. Correspondence includes letters from Kenneth Hayes Miller to Louise Emerson Rönnebeck.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {19768=This series contains photographs of family, friends and travels and of artwork by Arnold Rönnebeck and Louise Emerson Rönnebeck. Of particular note are photographs and snapshots taken by Arnold Rönnebeck documenting his visits to Taos, New Mexico in the 1920s and photographs of Charles Demuth, Mabel Dodge, Marsden Hartley, Tony Luhan, and Alfred Steiglitz photographing Georgia O'Keefe at Lake George in 1924. Photographs of works of art include Rönnebeck portrait busts of George Antheil, Ananda Coomaraswamy, Charles Demuth, Marsden Hartley, Charles Lindbergh, Georgia O'Keefee and Carl Sandburg., 53298=Copyright (c) 2015 Archives of American Art   |   Smithsonian Institution   |   Privacy   |   Terms of Use   |   Contact Us       }
textBeforeTable: (Box 1; 4 folders) Biographical Material, 1926, 1951-1968, 1996-2002 Series 1: Detailed Description and Container Inventory Return to top Arnold Rönnebeck and Louise Emerson Rönnebeck papers, 1884-2002. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. How to Cite this Collection The Arnold Rönnebeck and Louise Emerson Rönnebeck papers are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws. Ownership & Literary Rights Use of original papers requires an appointment. Restrictions on Use How to Use the Collection The collection was processed by Trina Yeckley in 2003, and a finding aid prepared by Stephanie Ashley in 2006. How the Collection was Processed Correspondence between Arnold Rönnebeck and Alfred Stieglitz and Marsden Hartley is located at the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library at Yale University. Separated and Related Materials The papers were donated in 2001 by Ursula Moore Works and Arnold Rönnebeck, the artists' daughter and son. Provenance Rönnebeck, Louise Emerson, 1901-1980 Miller, Kenneth Hayes, 1876-1952 Luhan, Tony Names: Writings Scrapbooks Drawings Sketches Sketchbooks Photographs Types of Materials: Artists -- New Mexico -- Taos Muralists Sculptors Portrait sculpture Subjects-Topical: Hartley, Marsden, 1877-1943 Demuth, Charles, 1883-1935 Stieglitz, Alfred, 1864-1946 Luhan, Mabel
